title: -The Radiative Capture Cross Section of Th-232 for Neutrons In The Energy Range 300 To 1200 Kev.-

x4codes.shortRef: Jour: Proceedings of the Physical Society (London),, Vol.74, p.685 (1959)

x4freetext: -THE RADIATIVE CAPTURE CROSS SECTION OF TH-232 FOR
NEUTRONS IN THE ENERGY RANGE 300 TO 1200 KEV.-

x4codes.hlp: Atomic Weapons Establishment (AWE), Aldermaston, United Kingdom

x4freetext: 6 MEV VAN DE GRAAFF.
TRITIUM GAS, PRESSURE ABOUT 1 ATM., 1 IN. LONG
CELL.
.TH-O(2) MADE OF TH, SEPARATED CHEMICALLY FROM ITS
DAUGHTER PRODUCTS. THIS OXYDE WAS PACKED INTO A
POLYSTYRENE CONTAINER, INNER DIAM. 2 CM, DEPTH 0.075
CM.
.U(3)-O(8) FOR THE MEASUREMENTS OF THE MONITOR. MADE
STARTING FROM METAL DEPLETED IN U-235, VIZ.
CONTAINING 0.02 WEIGHT PERC U-235, AND PURIFIED TO
99.9 PERC FROM ITS DAUGTHERS BY CHEMICAL SEPARATION.
ACTIVATION ANALYSIS.
END WINDOW GEIGER-MUELLER COUNTER, AND
LONGCOUNTER FOR N FLUX MONITORING.
NO MONITOR VALUES GIVEN.
DATA TAKEN FROM NEUDADA.
G.C.
.BACKGROUND DUE TO GROW-IN OF NATURAL DAUGHTERS IS
CORRECTED FOR, CORRECTION FOR N-FLUX VARIATION,
VARIATION OF THE EFFICIENCY OF THE LONGCOUNTER WITH
NEUTRON ENERGY, ANISOTROPIC OUTPUT OF THE TARGET,
OCCURENCE OF LOW ENERGY INCOMING NEUTRONS, AND PROTON
ENERGY LOSSES AT LOW ENERGIES.
.STANDARD DEVIATIONS ARE GIVEN.
DATA TAKEN FROM NEUDADA.
